title: AMD FSR Redstone press roundtable CES 2026 transcript company speaks out on why AI 400 lacks RDNA 4 GPU
summary: At CES 2026, AMD discussed their graphics technologies, including FSR Redstone, in a roundtable interview.

title: Microsoft built a Community-First AI Infrastructure framework for its data center projects new policy may be the blueprint for U.S hyperscalers to follow
summary: Microsoft argues against unchecked AI infrastructure expansion, promoting community support. This move may serve as a blueprint for other AI hyperscalers.

title: Nvidia China market share to drastically decrease from 66% to 8%, analysts claim  export curbs and homegrown success to blame
summary: A new report says Nvidia's presence is about to shrink drastically in China due to export curbs and homegrown success.

title: be quiet! Pure Power 13 M 650W power supply review: Balanced performance and reliability
summary: The Be quiet! Pure Power 13 M 650W delivers exceptional efficiency, comprehensive ATX 3.1 compliance, and refined acoustic performance, making it a compelling choice for users seeking reliability with a 10-year warranty.

title: Newegg bucks the trend by offering a $50 discount on 16GB of DDR5-6000 RAM   limited time deal on the cheapest kit you can buy
summary: Newegg is offering a $50 discount on 16GB of TeamGroup DDR5-6000 RAM with a limited time deal.

title: U.S. slashes Taiwan tariffs in new semiconductor trade deal
summary: The U.S. and Taiwan trade deal will reduce tariffs to 15% and pour $500 billion in investments in U.S. chip manufacturing.

title: Hard drive prices have surged by an average of 46% since September   iconic 24TB Seagate BarraCuda now $500 as AI claims another victim
summary: New research indicates that hard drive prices have increased by an average of nearly 50% in the last four months.

title: At 30% off, this remarkable $14 USB-rechargeable flashlight is an indispensable PC building tool Olight lights up the dark corners of any DIY project
summary: The Olight USB-rechargeable flashlight is a versatile tool for DIY projects, easy to use, and affordable. It can be clipped to keys, attached to a PC case with a magnet, and provides reliable lighting.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman raises $252 million for brain computer interface venture  but Merge Labs is still in an early research phase
summary: OpenAI has invested $252 million in Merge Labs to become a major player in brain computer interfaces (BCIs), which is currently in an early research phase.

title: Many high-capacity NVMe SSDs are now as expensive as gold by weight as shortage intensifies we ran the numbers, here's what we found
summary: High-capacity NVMe SSDs are becoming pricier than their gold weight due to a shortage.

title: Gigabyte CEO explains Nvidia's potential GPU supply strategy amid crushing memory shortages
summary: Gigabyte CEO Eddie Lin says revenue per gigabyte of GDDR7 memory on Nvidia graphics cards will decide which products thrive and face shortages in 2026.

title: Glass cloth could be the next great AI shortage, as major manufacturers scramble to secure critical material  Japanese manufacturer courted by Apple, Nvidia, Google, and Amazon
summary: A Japanese manufacturer is at the center of a new AI-driven supply shortage due to a crucial component called glass cloth, with companies like Apple, Nvidia, Google, and Amazon looking for alternatives.

title: Asus denies RTX 5070 Ti and RTX 5060 Ti discontinuation
summary: Asus claims it has no plans to stop selling the RTX 5070 Ti, but inconsistent messaging and supply constraints may impact availability.

title: Analyzing Washington's new AI accelerator export rules  smaller manufacturers suffer while Nvidia and AMD will reap the rewards
summary: The U.S. introduces new export rules for AI and HPC accelerators, allowing shipments of AMD's and Nvidia's GPUs to China if their developers meet American customer demands and Department of Commerce requirements.

title: Grab a Steelseries Apex 9 TKL with hot-swappable optical switches for $90.99 lowest price in over a year for this quality aluminum-frame keyboard
summary: Grab a Steelseries Apex 9 TKL with hot-swappable optical switches for $90.99. This is the lowest price in over a year for this quality aluminum-frame keyboard.

title: GlobalFoundries acquires ARC and RISC-V IP from Synopsys
summary: GlobalFoundries has acquired CPU IP from Synopsys, reshaping its role in the semiconductor supply chain from a mere chipmaker to an IP and manufacturing partner.

title: Gamers face another crushing blow as Nvidia allegedly slashes GPU supply by 20%, leaker claims no new GeForce gaming GPU until 2027
summary: Nvidia allegedly slashes GPU supply by 20% to its AIC partners, and there won't be any new GeForce graphics cards until 2027, according to a hardware leaker.

title: TSMC 'very nervous' about AI bubble concerns despite another record-setting quarter, but assured of demand
summary: TSMC expects continuous revenue growth due to AI demand and plans to invest $52-$56 billion in capital expenditures.

title: Trump introduces 25% tariff on export of chips, including Nvidia H200, AMD MI325X figure could increase in the future
summary: Trump allows exports of Nvidia H200 and AMD MI325X chips with a 25% tariff.

title: Examining DDR4 PC build options in 2026
summary: Building a PC with DDR4 is a cost-effective option, offering great performance, especially when using existing RAM.

title: AMD's upcoming Ryzen AI Max+ 392 hot on the heels of 9800X3D in early benchmarks   New Strix Halo APU almost matches Ryzen 7 beast in multi-core performance
summary: The Ryzen AI Max+ 392 has shown impressive results in early benchmarks, matching high-end desktop SKUs, with single-core and multi-core scores of 2,917 and 18,071 points respectively.

title: Dell's mega award-winning 34-inch Alienware QD-OLED gaming monitor drops to $499 all-time low pricing
summary: The Dell Alienware AW3423DWF monitor is back down to last year's Black Friday prices at $499.

title: HP Series 5 Pro 514PN Portable Monitor Review: Premium performance and price
summary: HP is targeting the upper echelon of portable monitors with the $299 Series 5 Pro 514PN.

title: Buying all DLC for Monster Hunter Wilds unlocks twice the FPS performance higher FPS accidentally paywalled by resource-hogging background check for paid content
summary: A performance-crushing bug in Monster Hunter Wilds appears to vanish as more DLC is purchased and added to the game.

title: Amazon buys first American-mined copper in a decade   Arizona mine to fuel AWS AI data centers in seismic two-year deal
summary: Amazon has struck a two-year deal to receive copper from an Arizona mine, for use in its AWS data centers in the U.S.

title: Shareholders sue Oracle over misleading statements related to $300 billion OpenAI data center build-out
summary: A group of investors have filed a class action lawsuit against Oracle, contending that it made misleading statements during its initial $18 billion bond drive, resulting in potential losses of $1.3 billion.

title: Raspberry Pi AI HAT+ 2 Review: The brains and the brawn
summary: Raspberry Pi's latest AI accessory features a more powerful Hailo NPU, enabling LLMs and image inference, but the price tag is a deciding factor.

title: Beijing blocks Chinese entities from using U.S. and Israeli cybersecurity software   VMWare and Fortinet among the affected vendors
summary: China instructs entities to stop using U.S. and Israeli cybersecurity software, specifically mentioning VMware and Fortinet.

title: New York State takes steps to ban 3D-printed guns
summary: New York State Governor Kathy Hochul proposes a ban on 3D-printed guns by requiring 3D printer manufacturers to prevent weapon printing.

title: Troublesome 16-pin connector sidelines $30,000 H200 Hopper GPU   repair technician saves the data center day by fixing power port
summary: A repair technician fixed the 16-pin power connector on a $30,000 H200 PCIe Hopper graphics card by soldering new pins.

title: Intel's comeback weapon to fight AMD reportedly drops this spring Core Ultra 200K Plus and 200HX Plus CPUs set for March or April launch
summary: Intel's upcoming Core Ultra 200K Plus and 200HX Plus CPUs are set for a March or April launch as part of the Arrow Lake Refresh and Panther Lake processors.

title: SK hynix to spend $13 billion on the world's largest HBM memory assembly plant amid the worst shortage on record
summary: SK hynix is investing $12.9 billion to build a campus-scale, HBM-only advanced packaging and test facility in Cheongju, South Korea, designed for the next generation of HBM memory.

title: U.S. posts official H200 and MI325X AI GPU export rules to China, but with plenty of caveats
summary: The U.S. may allow shipments of AI processors to China on a case-by-case basis, but with U.S. supply priority, limiting the number of GPUs that can be shipped.

title: AI chip design is pushing advanced chip packaging to its limits  workarounds exist for limits of 2.5D packaging, but are years away from viability
summary: Advanced chip design is moving away from the transistor and toward the package as AI accelerators and HPC devices grow larger and more complex.

title: Asus's recently released ROG Xbox Ally handheld gets a $100 price drop - get the Ryzen Z2 A-powered version with 16GB of RAM for under $500
summary: The ROG Xbox Ally, powered by AMD's Ryzen Z2 A chip and featuring a 120Hz display, has received a $100 price drop.

title: How do you use Tom's Hardware? Take our survey and be entered to win a $250 prize
summary: We here at Tom's Hardware are running a short audience survey to better understand who you are, what you do, and how you use our website.

title: Steam Machine to have fewer 'Verified' badge constraints
summary: Valve says 'Verified on Steam Deck' games will work well on the Steam Machine, providing a large number of titles that will run smoothly on launch.

title: Nvidia DLSS 4.5 Super Resolution leaves beta, available now to Nvidia app users
summary: Nvidia's DLSS 4.5 Super Resolution feature is now available to all users of the Nvidia app, having left beta. It includes support for over 400 titles with new presets.

title: Phison demos 10X faster AI inference on consumer PCs with software and hardware combo that enables 3x larger AI models  Nvidia, AMD, MSI, and Acer systems demoed with aiDAPTIV+
summary: Phison's aiDAPTIV+ stack enables large Mixture of Experts AI models and agentic AI workloads to run on client systems with limited memory capacity, achieving 10X faster AI inference and supporting 3x larger AI models.

title: Bambu Lab H2C review: It saves plastic but it's not quite a Tool Changer
summary: The Bambu Lab H2C saves plastic but does not save time. It has its benefits, but it is not a substitute for a Tool Changer.

title: Trump's cryptic remark states Apple has invested in Intel
summary: Trump made a cryptic remark during a press interview stating that Apple went in with Intel, but his words were unclear and potentially a slip of the tongue.

title: This HP Omen 45L gaming PC at $1,245 off is the cheapest way to bag an RTX 5090 graphics card
summary: Configure this HP Omen 45L gaming desktop to include an RTX 5090 graphics card to grab the GPU at its lowest price.

title: Seagate launches three new 32 TB hard drives across its product lines, all using CMR tech
summary: Seagate has released three new 32 TB hard drives across its product families, starting at $699.99 and having transfer speeds of up to 285 MB/s.

title: Chinese customs told to block H200 imports, report claims directive would effectively ban the Nvidia AI chip from China
summary: Chinese customs officers were allegedly told to disallow the entry of Nvidia H200 chips, effectively banning their entry into the country. The ban is reportedly for 'special circumstances' only.

title: SK hynix shows 16-Hi HBM4 memory for AI accelerators   48 GB at 10 GT/s over a 2,048 interface
summary: SK Hynix demonstrates 48 GB HBM4 memory with a 2,048-bit interface over at up to 10 GT/s

title: Report estimates $17 billion worth of bitcoin was stolen in 2025 alone  massive haul arises from impersonation tactics and the use of AI for scams
summary: 2025 saw the largest revenue generated through crypto scams to date with an estimated $17 billion stolen from victims worldwide.

title: Beijing reportedly limiting H200 purchases to those with special circumstances sources suggest only university R&D labs can acquire Nvidia GPUs in China
summary: China is reportedly limiting H200 GPU purchases to 'special circumstances' with undefined criteria. Companies may need a specific reason to acquire the GPU. This applies to Nvidia GPU purchases in China.

title: Qwen boss says Chinese AI models have 'less than 20%' chance of leapfrogging Western counterparts    despite China's $1 billion AI IPO week, capital can't close the gap alone
summary: China's AI sector raised over $1 billion through IPOs, but a Chinese AI firm's boss believes they have less than 20% chance of leapfrogging Western counterparts due to the gap in technology.

title: AMD's next-gen Ryzen AI 400 laptops could launch on January 22, five days ahead of Panther Lake Gorgon Point release date leaks through early Asus listing in China
summary: AMD's Ryzen AI 400 series laptops are reportedly launching on January 22, 2026, five days ahead of the expected Panther Lake Gorgon Point release. The laptops will feature the Ryzen AI 7 445 processor. The news comes from an early Asus listing in China.

title: Deepseek research touts memory breakthrough, decoupling compute power and RAM pools to bypass GPU & HBM constraints   Engram conditional memory module commits static knowledge to system RAM
summary: Deepseek has developed a new form of long-term memory for AI models called Engram, which outperforms its MoE counterparts and decouples compute power from system RAM pools.

title: Jetway P150CDN1 A 15-inch Alder Lake-N fanless industrial panel PC with 8 USB ports for kiosk and HMI
summary: The Jetway P150CDN1 is a 15-inch fanless industrial touch panel PC with a 10-point capacitive touchscreen, featuring an Intel N97 quad-core processor and 8 USB ports. It is designed for space-constrained or hygiene-sensitive environments. The device supports wall, panel, and VESA mounting for industrial and commercial touchscreen deployments.

title: NanoPC-T6 Plus Rockchip RK3588 SBC switches from LPDDR4x to LPDDR5 (up to 32GB)
summary: The NanoPC-T6 Plus SBC features an octa-core Rockchip RK3588 SoC, with improvements including up to 32GB LPDDR5 memory, two analog microphones, and restored M.2 Key-B socket for 4G LTE connectivity.

title: XIAO ESP32-C5  A tiny USB-C IoT board with dual-band WiFi 6, Bluetooth 5.0 LE, Zigbee, and Thread connectivity
summary: Seeed Studio has introduced the XIAO ESP32-C5, a tiny USB-C IoT board featuring dual-band WiFi 6, Bluetooth 5.0 LE, Zigbee, and Thread connectivity. It offers improved specifications compared to its predecessor, including a higher clock speed and increased memory. The board is suitable for IoT projects and products.

title: The End of the AI Toy Era: YouWare Launches YouBase to Deliver Production-Ready Business Tools (Sponsored)
summary: YouWare has launched YouBase, a production-ready engine that offers a missing link for enterprises looking to leverage AI for full-stack development, marking a shift from prototyping to production.

title: ESP32-S3 multi-radio Smart Home gateway features Ethernet, Zigbee, Thread, Z-Wave, Wi-Fi, BLE, and optional 4G LTE connectivity
summary: The SMLIGHT SLZB-Ultima is a multi-radio smart-home gateway with features like Ethernet, Zigbee, Thread, Z-Wave, Wi-Fi, BLE, and optional 4G LTE connectivity, making it suitable for advanced Home Assistant and DIY applications.

title: Geniatech introduces SMARC and OSM system-on-modules powered by NXP i.MX 95 SoC
summary: Geniatech has released two new SoMs powered by the NXP i.MX 95 Edge AI application processor, designed for smart retail, industrial automation, and other markets.

title: Raspberry Pi AI HAT+ 2 targets generative AI (LLM/VLM) with Hailo-10H accelerator
summary: The Raspberry Pi AI HAT+ 2 adds support for large language models (LLMs) and vision-language models (VLMs) to the Raspberry Pi 5, utilizing the 40 TOPS Hailo-10H AI accelerator with 8GB of dedicated on-board RAM.

title: reComputer Industrial R2135-12 review A Raspberry Pi CM5-powered fanless Edge AI PC with Hailo-8 AI accelerator
summary: The reComputer AI Industrial R2135-12 is an industrial edge computer based on the Raspberry Pi Compute Module 5 platform. It features 8 GB LPDDR4 memory, 32 GB eMMC storage, and various I/O options. The system runs an AI model for real-time people detection and sends results to an external microcontroller.

title: WeAct CAN485   A low-cost ESP32 board with CAN Bus and RS485 interfaces
summary: WeAct CAN485 is a low-cost ESP32 board with CAN Bus and RS485 interfaces, supporting WiFi and Bluetooth LE, and featuring a microSD card slot and USB-C port.

title: ESP-SensairShuttle ESP32-C5 kit supports Bosch Sensortec s BME690, BMI270, BMM350 environmental and motion sensors
summary: The ESP-SensairShuttle kit is a development board that supports Bosch Sensortec sensors and features Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5, and Zigbee connectivity. It is designed for motion sensing and large language model human-computer/machine interaction scenarios. The kit can be powered via USB or a LiPo battery.

title: eWeLink CUBE OS enables all SONOFF WiFi and Zigbee devices to connect to Matter
summary: SONOFF WiFi and Zigbee devices can now work with the Matter protocol through eWeLink CUBE OS on a Raspberry Pi, eliminating the need for the eWeLink app and allowing devices to work with Matter-compatible platforms.

title: StackChan is a cute, community-build, open-source AI desktop robot (Crowdfunding)
summary: StackChan is an open-source AI desktop robot with a 2-inch touchscreen display, camera, microphone array, and speaker for voice interaction. It features a dual-core CPU, multiple sensors, and supports Smart Home & IoT control. StackChan is based on the M5Stack CoreS3 ESP32-S3 IoT controller.

title: HalowLink 2 Wi-Fi HaLow access point and extender offers up to 1 km range, supports up to 1,000 IoT end devices
summary: GL.iNet's HalowLink 2 is a Wi-Fi HaLow access point and extender with up to 1 km range and 1,000 IoT device support, featuring a Mediatek MT7621 processor and Morse Micro MM8108 HaLow chipset.

title: Compex Wi-Fi 7 Dual-Band Dual-Concurrent Modules:  High-Performance Solutions for Next-Gen Connectivity (Sponsored)
summary: Compex has introduced a family of Wi-Fi 7 modules to support various band combinations, form factors, and deployment scenarios. The modules are powered by Qualcomm's QCN6224, QCN6274, and QCN9274 Waikiki radio chipsets and support advanced Wi-Fi 7 functions. They are available in standard MiniPCIe and M.2 E-Key form factors.

title: Radxa launches NX4 SoM with Rockchip RK3576(J) industrial SoC and NX4IO carrier board
summary: Radxa NX4 is a 260-pin SO-DIMM SoM built around the Rockchip RK3576(J) octa-core industrial SoC with a 6 TOPS NPU for edge AI workloads. It supports up to 16GB LPDDR5 memory and various storage options. The NX4IO carrier board provides interfaces for video output, cameras, and storage.

title: Upgraded Sipeed NanoKVM-USB USB KVM solution gains 4K 60 FPS video capture and HDMI loop output
summary: Sipeed has released an upgraded NanoKVM-USB USB KVM adapter, which now supports 4K 60 FPS capture and 4Kp60 HDMI loop output. The new adapter retains the same ports as the earlier model and adds a USB Type-A port for switching between host and target modes. It connects to the target via HDMI and USB-C, and to the host via USB-C.

title: Milk-V Titan A $329 octa-core 64-bit RISC-V mini-ITX motherboard with a PCIe Gen4 x16 slot
summary: The Milk-V Titan is a mini-ITX motherboard powered by an UltraRISC UR-DP1000 octa-core RISC-V CPU, supporting up to 64GB memory, M.2 NVMe storage, and a PCIe Gen4 x16 slot.

title: Xibo open-source digital signage solution now works with Raspberry Pi 5 thanks to the Arexibo project
summary: Xibo digital signage solution is now compatible with the Raspberry Pi 5 thanks to Axeribo, a Rust-based alternative. This comes after years of development, and it offers better performance compared to previous attempts. Axeribo is designed for Linux platforms and provides hardware video decoding.

title: LILYGO T-Beam 1W An ESP32-S3 + SX1262 high-power LoRa dev board with 32 dBm output, GNSS support
summary: The LILYGO T-Beam-1W is a high-power LoRa development board with a built-in 1 Watt amplifier, featuring an ESP32-S3 CPU, SX1262 RF transceiver, and L76K GNSS module. It has a 7.4V battery, cooling fan, and supports USB-C, microSD slot, and Qwiic connectors. The board runs on a 7.4V battery and includes a cooling fan.

title: AMD Embedded+ mini-ITX Board features Ryzen AI Embedded P132 CPU, Versal AI Edge Gen2 VE3558 SoC FPGA
summary: Sapphire Technology introduced the EDGE+VPR-7P132, an AMD Embedded+ Mini-ITX motherboard with a Ryzen AI Embedded P132 CPU and Versal AI Edge Gen 2 VE3558 SoC FPGA, featuring significant upgrades over last year's model.

title: XIAO ePaper DIY Kit   EE02   An ESP32-S3 board designed for 13.3-inch Spectra 6 color E-Ink display
summary: Seeed Studio's XIAO ePaper DIY Kit EE02 is an ESP32-S3 WiFi and Bluetooth board designed for a 13.3-inch color ePaper display, suitable for digital frames and information boards.

title: Home Assistant-compatible Makerfabs ESP32-S3-based energy meter features BL0942 energy metering IC
summary: The Energy Meter for Home Assistant is an ESP32-S3-based energy monitoring and control module with real-time power and energy consumption measurements, remote on/off control, and electrical isolation. It operates from AC 100-240V and includes an onboard 15A relay. Connectivity is done through USB and Wi-Fi using ESPHome for easy integration with Home Assistant.

title: SECO's COM Express Type 6 module features Intel Core Ultra Series 3 Panther Lake-H processor with up to 180 TOPS
summary: SECO has announced the SOM-COMe-BT6-PTL, a COM Express Type 6 Basic module that supports the Intel Core Ultra X9 series processors and delivers up to 180 TOPS of AI performance. It features high-speed expansion, multiple display interfaces, and is designed for rugged and mission-critical applications. The module is available with an optional industrial temperature range.

title: 6-core Intel Wildcat Lake Core Series 3 CPUs to succeed Alder Lake-N and Twin Lake families
summary: Intel introduced the Core Series 3 Wildcat Lake processors with 2x Cougar Cover P-cores and 4x Darkmont LPE-cores, and 2x Xe-core Intel Xe3 graphics. The new CPUs are designed to succeed Alder Lake-N and Twin Lake families. However, the company has yet to disclose part names.

title: Quectel SRG091X and SRG093X NXP i.MX 9 industrial AIoT modules integrates Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.4, and 802.15.4 radios
summary: Quectel released two low-power industrial AIoT modules based on NXP i.MX 9 series SoCs, integrating Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.4, and 802.15.4 radios. The SRG091X is an entry-level solution with a single-core processor, while the SRG093X features a dual-core SoC with a real-time core and NPU for edge AI workloads.

title: MUSE Book laptop review Testing an octa-core RISC-V Linux laptop in 2026
summary: A review of the MUSE Book RISC-V Linux laptop, which features an octa-core 64-bit RISC-V SoC, 14.1-inch IPS display, and Bianbu OS 2.3 (Ubuntu 24.04-based) on RISC-V hardware.

title: Reolink Floodlight 4K Smart PoE and WiFi 6 security cameras add on-device LLM for natural language video search
summary: Reolink introduced the Elite Floodlight WiFi and Elite Pro Floodlight PoE, two new 4K security cameras with on-device Large Language Model (LLM) for natural-language video search.

title: Intel Core Ultra Series 3 Panther Lake-H CPU powers TGS-2000 series stackable Edge AI computers
summary: Intel unveiled the Core Ultra Series 3 processors, codenamed Panther Lake-H, which power the TGS-2000 series of stackable Edge AI computers. The TGS-2000 series is designed for high-performance space-constrained applications and offers up to 100 TOPS combined performance. The series is available in three variants, including a fanless model.

title: AMD launches Ryzen AI Embedded P100 and X100 processors with up to 50 TOPS of AI performance
summary: AMD has introduced the Ryzen AI Embedded P100 and X100 processors for AI-driven applications at the edge, featuring high-performance Zen 5 core architecture and up to 50 TOPS of AI performance.

title: Quectel SP895BD-AP AIoT module features Qualcomm Dragonwing Q-8750 SoC with 80 TOPS NPU
summary: Quectel launched the SP895BD-AP smart AIoT module based on the Qualcomm Dragonwing Q-8750 SoC, designed for high-performance IoT applications with an 8-core CPU, Adreno Series 8 GPU, and 80 TOPS NPU.

title: Nordic Semi nRF54LM20B wireless SoC integrates 128 MHz Axon NPU for Edge AI workloads
summary: Nordic Semi's nRF54LM20B wireless SoC integrates an ultra-efficient Axon Neural Processing Unit (NPU) for edge AI workloads, delivering up to 7 times faster performance and 8 times higher energy efficiency. It has the same features as the nRF54LM20A, including a 128 MHz Arm Cortex-M33 CPU, high-speed USB, and an ultra-low-power 2.4 GHz radio. The NPU is 15x faster than the Cortex-M33 CPU for the same task.

title: STM32MP21 Arm Cortex-A35/M33 MPU targets cost-effective applications in smart factories, homes, and cities
summary: STMicroelectronics STM32MP21 combines a 1.5 GHz 64-bit Arm Cortex-A35 and a 300 MHz 32-bit Arm Cortex-M33 core for cost-aware edge applications.
